subject: Home & DIY
title: The Spring Mattress Revolution
description: A fast breakdown of The Spring Mattress Revolution for builders.

hook.text: Before 1871, mattresses were sacks of straw, horsehair, or wool. Heinrich Westphal changed sleep with coiled steel.

buildup.text: Westphal placed steel coil springs inside a fabric casing, creating consistent support that didn't flatten overnight.

discovery.text: Springs distribute weight evenly and bounce back to shape. For the first time, a bed supported every sleeper equally.

twist.text: Westphal died poorâ€”he never profited from his invention. Companies like Simmons and Sealy built empires on his idea.

climax.text: Today memory foam and latex are overtaking springs, but 60% of mattresses sold worldwide still use coil technology.

punchline.text: Steel coils gave the world a good night's sleep.
